sentences.english: Like Bush, Hoover is said to have become depressed.
sentences.chinese: 像布什一樣，據說胡佛變得鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: The loneliness got her down when she moved to Portugal.
sentences.chinese: 她搬到葡萄牙去之後，孤獨的生活讓她變得鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: A: You're looking pretty down these days.
sentences.chinese: 你這幾天看來很鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: Let's say your friend is not doing so well lately.
sentences.chinese: 假如你有一個朋友，最近老是鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: He remained heavy and somewhat uncouth.
sentences.chinese: 他依舊鬱鬱寡歡，並且有點粗野。

sentences.english: Please excuse me if I'm a little pensive today.
sentences.chinese: 如不美觀我今天有點鬱鬱寡歡，請原諒我。

sentences.english: I think he is proud，and also unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得他很高傲，而且鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: He had plunged into an involved melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 他陷入鬱鬱寡歡的境地。

sentences.english: Is a retreat from unhappy cable legislation, a pair of lovers was whispering leaned.
sentences.chinese: 一個是鬱鬱寡歡離羣索立，一對則情侶依偎竊竊私語。

sentences.english: He became insular, emotionally dead, passionless and morose.
sentences.chinese: 菲的死讓明變得孤僻，他心灰意冷，鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: It used to be said that English people take their pleasure sadly.
sentences.chinese: 以前人們常說，英國人享樂時也鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: As a result Heath rarely exhibited Nixon's crippling diffidence.
sentences.chinese: 因此，希思很少表現出尼克松那種鬱鬱寡歡。

definition: lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
